revised_title: The Mechanism and Forces Behind the Ascent of Water in Trees
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Physiology
tldr: The author investigates the forces and mechanisms required for water to ascend in trees. They found that the resistance offered by the viscosity of water and narrow conducting vessels in the tree's stem plays a significant role in the ascent of sap. The author also examines the influence of external factors, such as temperature and dissolved air, on the ascent of water in trees.
